intro: Hieracium temperatum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium temperatum is often found in moist soils and can form dense colonies in suitable environments.
